info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 12:24PM PDT until July 26 at 2:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 245 PM PDT. * At 1224 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain on the northeast slopes of the Spring Mountains. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen on and just northwest of Lee Canyon Road near mile marker 6. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lee Canyon Road. Trails northwest of Lee Canyon Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
